Yue,

You need to add the directory to your path as well.

*************
Vlad -

This has been documented here several times.  Do we have any means of
adding/creating an FAQ on the sourceforge page?
*************
-Jason

    > -----Original Message-----
    > From: Yue Wu [mailto:wybox@...]
    > Sent: Friday, June 29, 2001 9:17 AM
    > To: junit@yahoogroups.com
    > Subject: [junit] (unknown)
    > 
    > 
    > Hi, 
    > I load junit to my PC in NT, and jdk1.2.2. Unzip
    > junit32.zip(change junit3.2 root directory to junit32,
    > because it's confused with java path). Add junit.jar
    > to the classpath. When I run " java
    > junit32.junit.ui.TestRunner
    > junit32.junit.samples.AllTests" command, got this
    > message:
    > 
    > Exception in thread "main"
    > java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError:
    > junit32/junit/ui/TestRunner
    >  
    > How come it is? I unziped src.zip to the root
    > directory (junit32 here) and compile TestRunner.java
    > to class file. What's wrong here? I'll be appreciated
    > if someone can point out to me.
    > 
    > Oliver
